flawed_nl_solution:
The girls make up one-third of the campers, so there are 96 /3 = <<96/3=32>>32 girls.
The boys make up two-thirds of the campers, so there are 32 + 32 = <<32+32=60>>60 boys.
There are 32 x 75% = <<32*75*0.01=24>>24 girls who want to toast marshmallows.
There are 60 x 50% = <<60*50*0.01=30>>30 boys who want to toast marshmallows.
They need 24 + 30 = <<24+30=54>>54 marshmallows.
#### 54

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 64, not 60. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
